comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

Hold up here. 

"The law lists 25 physical or psychological conditions — including unsuccessful abortions, infections, uterine perforations, depression and deaths"

With the exception of depression, I would hope this data for ANY and ALL medical procedures was being collected and analyzed by each states department of health. If a person dies during any medical procedure, that didnt have a high chance of death, I would hope we collect this data to try and reduce the chances of it happening.

We seriously need a law stating that this data is collected? It should be a given for all medical procedures. That is literally how they are improved.

Also, "Planned Parenthood challenged the law in federal court, arguing that it was vague " vague, what is vague about this. I mean how does a doctor miss those or mistaken them for something else?

I awear to God, this is the dumbest thing I habe heard of. Data we should be collecting on all procedures isnt, and a organization that wants to protect womens health is afraid of the data being collected.

While I question the true intentions behind this law, their shouldnt be a need for this law to begin with. That data should for any medical procedure should already be collected (anonymized) and studied by doctors.

What is next, we dont require drug companies ro report problems patients report with their drugs.
Indiana... the Mississippi of the Midwest
Sigh. We waste our taxes on laws that harm women.
